results.title: Blue Murder: Part 1
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Southern Star Entertainment, Rod Allan and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description:
Based on the events that led to the Royal Commission on Police Corruption in New South Wales, ‘Blue Murder’ is a riveting and exceptionally well executed thriller about police corruption and gangland criminal activity in 1980s Australia.
Richard Roxburgh is outstanding as Roger Rogerson, the larrikin police chief who built a lucrative ‘alternative’ career based on bribery, drug money and murder. Tony Martin is Neddy Smith, one of Australia’s most notorious underworld thugs.
Rogerson and Smith’s activities are threatened when a young police officer, Michael Drury (Steve Bastoni), declines a bribe offered to him by Rogerson. From that moment on, ‘Blue Murder’ depicts how Drury’s involvement in acting as an informer on Rogerson’s activities led to increasingly desperate and murderous acts by both police and crims.
Acclaimed internationally as a landmark television mini-series, ‘Blue Murder’ was for years unable to be screened in NSW or available for view on video in Australia due to elements of the story being seen as prejudicial to legal trials in NSW and Federal Courts.
Cast also inlcudes Alex Dimitriades, Peter Phelps and John Hargreaves.
First broadcast (outside NSW) September 14th, 1995.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Southern Star Entertainment, Rod Allan and Michael Jenkins

results.title: Blue murder [DVD]
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC, Southern Star Entertainment, Rod Allan and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description: Based on the events that led to the Royal Commission on Police Corruption in New South Wales, “Blue Murder” is a rivetting and exceptionally well executed thriller about police corruption and gangland criminal activity in Australia. The convincing script by Ian David focuses on both the intricacies of corruption in the police force, as well as examining the sometimes Byzantine behaviour and “moral” codes of the organised crime world. Richard Roxburgh is outstanding as Roger Rogerson, the larrikin police chief whose egalitarian blokey demeanor allows him to build a lucrative “alternative” career based on bribery, drug money and murder. Tony Martin is Neddy Smith, one of Australia’s most notorious underworld thugs who, by being the conduit between the police and the criminal underworld, is able to build an extensive drug empire in Australia. Rogerson and Smith’s activities are threatened when a young police officer, Michael Drury (Steve Bastoni), declines a bribe offered to him by Rogerson. From that moment on, “Blue Murder” depicts how Drury’s involvement in acting as an informer on Rogerson’s activities led to increasing desperate and murderous acts by both police and crims. Acclaimed internationally as a landmark television mini-series, “Blue Murder” was for years unable to be screened in NSW or available for view on video in Australia due to elements of the story being seen as prejudicial to legal trials in NSW and Federal Courts. Apart from the leads, the mini-series features excellent performances by Alex Dimitriades, Peter Phelps and John Hargreaves.

results.title: Blue Mountains: moving memories: 1920's - 1970's
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: The National Film and Sound Archive has assembled a superb compilation of historic footage which follows the growth and development of the Blue Mountains, one of the most spectacular natural features of the Australian continent. Original commentary has been retained and music selected by the NFSA has been added to the silent segments. The footage has been gleaned from home movies, documentaries and newsreels and amongst the many items of interest is the feature on Norman Lindsay’s house and garden.

results.title: Blue mould of tobacco
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: Recommended methods of controlling the Blue Mould disease which is a fungus living on tobacco plants. The disease is widespread in the Australian tobacco industry. Samples of infected plants; how it is spread; the use of benzol vapour as recommended by Research Officers; fertilizing the soil; irrigation by furrow and boom spray methods; helicopter and plane spraying; the work of the Research Laboratories which test suspected plants; and work towards breeding a blue mould resistant strain of tobacco.

results.title: Blue fin (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Hal McElroy and Carl Schultz
results.brief_description: Pascoe expects too much from his son Snook, who always seems to be in trouble. Disaster strikes Blue Fin at sea and young Snook is the only one who can save them. The boat is wrecked and sinking. Pascoe lies injured and the crew swept overboard. Blue Fin is a heart warming story of youth growing to maturity and of human relationships.

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: Chancom, Colosimo Film Productions, Rosa Colosimo and Marc Gracie
results.brief_description: Set on location in a small country town in Victoria this is a story of two unlikely individuals, a world apart socially and culturally, brought together through a set of circumstances. It is a story of friendship, family and loyalty. Cast includes Peter Adams, Joe Dolce, Kate Gorman, Bruce Kane, Elspeth Ballantyne, Denise Drysdale.

results.title: Blowhard
results.creator_credit: ACCESS, ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott, Brad Caslor and Christopher Hinton
results.brief_description: An animated parable that deals with a familiar subject in an amusing way. We join in the business ventures of J.B. Edwards, an Easterner, who went West to create a fuel company called Consolidated Dragons. The company’s profits were sorely affected when the supply of dragons started to dry up. A solution had to be found - and was. Designed to encourage discussion of energy conservation. (Awards: Yorkton, Rio de Janeiro)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACCESS, ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott, Brad Caslor and Christopher Hinton

results.title: Blow out = La Grande bouffe
results.creator_credit: Mara Film, Films 66, Capitolina Produzioni Cinematografica, Jean-Pierre Rassam and Marco Ferreri
results.brief_description: In this grotesque black comedy, four rich, bored middle-aged men decide they have had enough of the tiresome life around them and decide to meet at a remote villa with the goal of ending their lives in one last decadent, drunken, depraved, orgiastic and impeccably well-catered marathon assault on their systems. The quartet comes from various walks of life— a pilot (Marcello Mastroianni), a chef (Ugo Tognazzi), a television host (Michel Piccoli), and a judge (Philippe Noiret) but all are successful men with excessive appetites for life’s pleasures (food is used as mere metaphor here, as graphic as that metaphor becomes). Ferreri’s sexual and scatalogical catalogue of the men’s indulgence of excesses, leaves no sensibility unassaulted. Cast also includes Andrea Ferreol. In French with English subtitles.
